snippet: President Hamid Karzai charged that the American government and the Taliban had in effect colluded to keep Afghanistan unstable in order to justify a continued American military presence.
abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai levels particularly harsh accusations against United States in news conference, suggesting that Americans and Taliban have in effect colluded to keep Afghanistan unstable in order to justify a continued American military presence; comments cast shadow on first visit by Chuck Hagel as defense secretary, and raise new questions about two countries' abilities to bridge their intensifying differences.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and THOM SHANKER
byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai charged that the American government and the Taliban had in effect colluded to keep Afghanistan unstable in order to justify a continued American military presence.
